overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It prioritizes simplicity by identifying daily seasonality as the dominant pattern and dismissing complex models like ARIMA/ETS due to insufficient history. The method relies on hourly averaging after confirming no significant trend, resulting in a straightforward but contextually appropriate solution.
common_data_patterns: Weekend effect consideration (though dismissed due to insufficient data)
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts model complexity and prevents weekly pattern capture
Daily averages used to verify trend absence before applying hourly averaging
Explicit handling of datetime continuity for forecast period alignment
Data rounding and formatting consistency enforced for output
complexity_analysis: Moderately detailed with strong data inspection: Includes data completeness checks, trend/seasonality analysis, and method comparisons, but defaults to simple heuristics due to data constraints.
